messages.message: Did someone happen to accidentally run the database update script (dbupdate) either locally, or by pushing it to the dogfood or UAT environment? The script is not yet ready to be run, but it looks like someone did.

There’s also a bunch of random tables in the DB, `NEWJOBS`, `MODEL_REGISTRATION`, `JOBS_V_TEST` , `JOBS_V1`, `JOBS_V2` , `JOBS_V3`, `JOBS_V4` . Can we not test against this database and test against a clone?
I did not, could it be part of the deployment script that got triggered?
dbupdate isn’t part of any deployment script yet :thinking_face:
Does sandbox share the same db by any chance? (Hope not)
it doesn’t, it’s local, dogfood and UAT.
Well the Oracle DB on RDS only supports 1 DB. So it will have to be as tables for now, unless I  copy over 800k rows to a New DB using dump + load.
I might have done this accidentally not sure. I didn't run any migration for the atleast past 3 days so if it is recent its not me.
it seems recent, likely happened today? Pridhvi and Adrian first noticed the regression this afternoon (not tagging them since it’s late)

I did not run it either.

Those extra tables can/should be dropped. I am assuming they are not causing the slowness though, are they?
